intro: Romulea grandiscapa, commonly known as the giant sand-verbena, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces striking, showy inflorescences composed of numerous white or pale pink flowers arranged in a cyme. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Romulea grandiscapa is often found in open grasslands and is known for its ornamental value in horticulture.
